member.name: P:Atom.SDK.Net.Helpers.SDKLogger.LogDir
member.summary: Directory to log to
member.remarks: Default is the application's current working directory. Can be set using . Log file is assembled in using string.Format("{0}\\{1}{2}{3}.{4}", LogDir, Prefix, dateTime.ToString(DateFormat), Suffix, Extension).

member.name: P:Atom.SDK.Net.Helpers.SDKLogger.Prefix
member.summary: Prefix to use in file name
member.remarks: Default is the empty string, i.e. no prefix. Log file is assembled in using string.Format("{0}\\{1}{2}{3}.{4}", LogDir, Prefix, dateTime.ToString(DateFormat), Suffix, Extension).

member.name: P:Atom.SDK.Net.Helpers.SDKLogger.Suffix
member.summary: Suffix to use in file name
member.remarks: Default is the empty string, i.e. no suffix. Log file is assembled in using string.Format("{0}\\{1}{2}{3}.{4}", LogDir, Prefix, dateTime.ToString(DateFormat), Suffix, Extension).

member.name: P:Atom.SDK.Net.Helpers.SDKLogger.Extension
member.summary: Extension to use in file name
member.remarks: Default is "log". Set to null to return to default. Log file is assembled in using string.Format("{0}\\{1}{2}{3}.{4}", LogDir, Prefix, dateTime.ToString(DateFormat), Suffix, Extension).

member.name: P:Atom.SDK.Net.Helpers.SDKLogger.DateFormat
member.summary: Date format to use in file name
member.remarks: Default is "yyyy_MM_dd" (e.g. 2013_04_21), which leads to a daily change of the log file. Set to null to return to default. Set to e.g. "yyyy_MM_dd_HH" to change log file hourly. Log file is assembled in using string.Format("{0}\\{1}{2}{3}.{4}", LogDir, Prefix, dateTime.ToString(DateFormat), Suffix, Extension).

member.name: P:Atom.SDK.Net.Helpers.SDKLogger.LogLevel
member.summary: Log level
member.remarks:
Log all entries with set here and above. In other words, do not write entries to the log file with severity below the severity specified here.
For example, when log level is set to , incoming entries with severity , , and are actually written to the log file. When log level is set to e.g. , only entries with severity and are actually written to the log file. Default is . for details.

member.name: P:Atom.SDK.Net.Helpers.SDKLogger.StartExplicitly
member.summary: Whether logging has to be started explicitly as opposed to start automatically on first log. Default is false.
member.remarks: Normally, logging starts automatically when the first log entry is enqueued, . In some situations, it may be desired to start logging explicitly at a later time. In the meantime, logging entries are enqued and are processed (i.e. written to the log file) when logging is started. To start logging, use

member.name: P:Atom.SDK.Net.Helpers.SDKLogger.WriteText
member.summary: Whether to write plain text instead of XML. Default is false.

member.name: P:Atom.SDK.Net.Helpers.SDKLogger.TextSeparator
member.summary: When is true, this is the separator text entries reperesenting attributes or values are separated with. Defaults to " | ".

member.name: P:Atom.SDK.Net.Helpers.SDKLogger.FileName
member.summary: File to log in
member.remarks: Is assembled from , , the current date and time formatted in , , "." and . So, by default, the file is named e.g. "2013_04_21.log" and is written to the current working directory. It is assembled in using string.Format("{0}\\{1}{2}{3}.{4}", LogDir, Prefix, dateTime.ToString(DateFormat), Suffix, Extension).

member.name: P:Atom.SDK.Net.Helpers.SDKLogger.StopEnqueingNewEntries
member.summary: Whether to stop enqueing new entries.
member.remarks: Use to stop logging and to start logging.

member.name: P:Atom.SDK.Net.Helpers.SDKLogger.StopLoggingRequested
member.summary: Whether to stop logging background task is requested, i.e. to stop logging at all is requested.
member.remarks: Use to stop logging and to start logging.

member.name: P:Atom.SDK.Net.Helpers.SDKLogger.LastExceptionInBackgroundTask
member.summary: Last exception that occurred in the background task when trying to write to the file.

member.remarks: When this number is 1000 or more, there seems to be a permanent problem to wite to the file. See what it could be.

member.name: P:Atom.SDK.Net.Helpers.SDKLogger.LoggingStarted

member.remarks: If logging is not running (yet), log methods can be called anyway. Messages will be written to disk when logging is started. See for details.

Try to create directory if not existing. Default is false.

member.name: M:Atom.SDK.Net.Helpers.SDKLogger.Check(System.String)
member.summary: Check if logging to works
member.remarks: Writes a test entry directly to without using the background task. When no exception is returned, logging to works.
member.param: Test message to write to the log file
member.returns: Null on success, otherwise an exception with what went wrong.

member.name: M:Atom.SDK.Net.Helpers.SDKLogger.Info(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Write info message to log
member.param: The message to write to the log
Whether to use the background task (thread) to write messages to disk. Default is true. This is much faster than writing directly to disk in the main thread.
member.returns: Null on success or the that occurred when processing the message, i.e. when enqueuing the message (when is true) or when writing the message to disk (when is false).

Whether to use the background task (thread) to write messages to disk. Default is true. This is much faster than writing directly to disk in the main thread.
member.returns: Null on success or the that occurred when processing the message, i.e. when enqueuing the message (when is true) or when writing the message to disk (when is false).

member.summary: Write error message to log

Whether to use the background task (thread) to write messages to disk. Default is true. This is much faster than writing directly to disk in the main thread.
member.returns: Null on success or the that occurred when processing the message, i.e. when enqueuing the message (when is true) or when writing the message to disk (when is false).

member.name: M:Atom.SDK.Net.Helpers.SDKLogger.Log(System.Exception,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Write exception to log
member.param: The exception to write to the log
Whether to use the background task (thread) to write messages to disk. Default is true. This is much faster than writing directly to disk in the main thread.
How many frames to skip when detecting the calling method, . This is useful when log calls to are wrapped in an application. Default is 0.
member.returns: Null on success or the that occurred when processing the message, i.e. when enqueuing the message (when is true) or when writing the message to disk (when is false).

member.name: M:Atom.SDK.Net.Helpers.SDKLogger.GetExceptionAsXmlString(System.Exception)
member.summary: Gets an XML string with detailed information about an exception
member.remarks: Recursively adds elements for inner exceptions. For the most inner exception, the stack trace is added. Tags for are added. Specific properties of the exception types , and are recognized, too.
member.param: The exception to get detailed information about
member.returns: An XML string with detailed information about the passed exception

member.remarks: Recursively adds elements for inner exceptions. For the most inner exception, the stack trace is added. Tags for are added. Specific properties of the exception types , and are recognized, too.

member.name: M:Atom.SDK.Net.Helpers.SDKLogger.Log(System.String,Atom.SDK.Net.Helpers.SDKLogger.Severity,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Write message to log
member.remarks: See .
member.param: The message to write to the log
Log entry severity
Whether to use the background task (thread) to write messages to disk. Default is true. This is much faster than writing directly to disk in the main thread.
How many frames to skip when detecting the calling method, . This is useful when log calls to are wrapped in an application. Default is 0.
member.returns: Null on success or the that occurred when processing the message, i.e. when enqueuing the message (when is true) or when writing the message to disk (when is false).

member.name: M:Atom.SDK.Net.Helpers.SDKLogger.Log(System.Xml.Linq.XElement,Atom.SDK.Net.Helpers.SDKLogger.Severity,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Write XElement to log
member.remarks:
Unless is set to false (default is true), the XElement is not actually written to the file here, but enqueued to the log entry queue. It is dequeued by in a backround task and actually written to the file there. This is much faster than writing directly to disk in the main thread (what is done when is set to false).
However, writing to the file is synchronized between threads. I.e. writing directly can be done from multiple threads. Also, using the background task and writing directly to the file can be used both in parallel.
When is set to true (default is false), the background task must be started explicitly by calling , to get messages actually written to the file. They get enqueued before the background task is started, though. I.e. they will get logged when the background task is started later.
When is set to false, which is the default, logging background task (thread) is started automatically when first calling this method with set to true (which is the default).
member.param: The XElement to log
Log entry severity, defaults to
Whether to use the background task (thread) to write messages to disk. Default is true. This is much faster than writing directly to disk in the main thread.
How many frames to skip when detecting the calling method, . This is useful when log calls to are wrapped in an application. Default is 0.
member.returns: Null on success or the that occurred when processing the message, i.e. when enqueuing the message (when is true) or when writing the message to disk (when is false).

member.name: M:Atom.SDK.Net.Helpers.SDKLogger.ShowLogFile
member.summary: Shows the current log file
member.remarks: Opens the default program to show text or XML files and displays the requested file, if it exists. Does nothing otherwise. When is false, a temporary XML file is created and saved in the users's temporary path each time this method is called. So don't use it excessively in that case. Otherwise, the log file itself is shown.

member.name: M:Atom.SDK.Net.Helpers.SDKLogger.ShowLogFile(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Show a log file for the passed date
member.remarks: Opens the default program to show text or XML files and displays the requested file, if it exists. Does nothing otherwise. When is false, a temporary XML file is created and saved in the users's temporary path each time this method is called. So don't use it excessively in that case. Otherwise, the log file itself is shown.
member.param: The date and time to show the log file for.

member.name: M:Atom.SDK.Net.Helpers.SDKLogger.StartLogging
member.summary: Start logging
member.remarks: Start background task pointing to to write log files to disk. Is called automatically by when the first entry is logged, unless is set to true (default is false). Then, this method has to be called explicitly to start logging.

member.name: M:Atom.SDK.Net.Helpers.SDKLogger.StopLogging(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Stop logging background task, i.e. logging at all.
member.remarks: Stop background task pointing to to write log files to disk.
member.param: Whether to write all pending entries to disk before. Default is true.

member.name: M:Atom.SDK.Net.Helpers.SDKLogger.Flush
member.summary: Wait for all entries having been written to the file

member.name: M:Atom.SDK.Net.Helpers.SDKLogger.ClearQueue
member.summary: Clear background task's log entry queue. I.e. remove all log messages waiting to be written to by the background task.

member.name: M:Atom.SDK.Net.Helpers.SDKLogger.Enqueue(System.Xml.Linq.XElement)
member.summary: Enqueue log entry to be written to log file
member.remarks:
When is set to false (which is the default), logging is started automatically by calling from inside this method when the first is enqueued.
When is set to true, is just enqueued, but not yet actually written to the log file. The latter will be done when is called explicitly.
member.param: The log entry to be enqueued

member.name: M:Atom.SDK.Net.Helpers.SDKLogger.Peek
member.summary: Get the next log entry from the queue, but do not dequeue it
member.returns: The next element or null when the queue is empty

member.name: M:Atom.SDK.Net.Helpers.SDKLogger.Dequeue
member.summary: Dequeue log entry

member.name: M:Atom.SDK.Net.Helpers.SDKLogger.WriteLogEntriesToFile
member.summary: Write log entries to the file on disk
member.remarks: The thread looks every 100 milliseconds for new items in the queue.

member.name: M:Atom.SDK.Net.Helpers.SDKLogger.WriteOwnExceptionToEventLog(System.Exception)
member.summary: Write exceptions happening here, i.e. to the event log.
member.remarks: When there are exceptions occurring when we try to write to disk, sometimes it is hard to find out why this fails. That's why they are written to the event log here. For not to clutter up event log too much, doubles are sorted out. The event is written as an error to the application event log under source "SimpleLog".
member.param: The exception to write to the event log.

member.name: M:Atom.SDK.Net.Helpers.SDKLogger.WriteLogEntryToFile(System.Xml.Linq.XElement)
member.summary: Write one log entry to file
member.remarks: This method can be called from the logging background thread or directly from the main thread. Lock accordingly to avoid multiple threads concurrently accessing the file. When the lock can not be got within five seconds, is not being written to the file, but a respective exception is returned, saying what went wrong.
member.param: The entry to write
member.returns: Null when all worked fine, an exception otherwise

member.name: M:Atom.SDK.Net.Helpers.SDKLogger.ConvertXmlToPlainText(System.Xml.Linq.XElement)
member.summary: Convert to plain text to be written to a file.
member.remarks:
A typical xml entry to be converted looks like this:
<LogEntry Date="2014-06-19 11:20:52" Severity="Info" Source="SimpleLogDemo.Program.DoSomethingElse" ThreadId="9"> <Message>Entering method. See Source which method is meant.</Message> </LogEntry> <LogEntry Date="2014-06-19 11:20:52" Severity="Exception" Source="SimpleLogDemo.Program.DoSomething" ThreadId="9"> <Exception Type="System.Exception" Source="SimpleLogDemo.Program.DoSomethingElse"> <Message>Something went wrong.</Message> <Exception Type="System.NullReferenceException" Source="SimpleLogDemo.Program.DoSomethingElse"> <Message>Object reference not set to an instance of an object.</Message> <StackTrace> at SimpleLogDemo.Program.DoSomethingElse(String fred) in D:\Projekt\VisualStudio\SimpleLogDemo\SimpleLogDemo\Program.cs:line 91</StackTrace> </Exception> </Exception> </LogEntry>
This is a basic implementation so far. Feel free to implement your own if you need something more sophisticated, e.g. nicer exception formatting.
member.param: The XML entry to convert.
member.returns: converted to plain text.

member.name: M:Atom.SDK.Net.Helpers.SDKLogger.GetCaller(System.Int32)
member.summary: Detects the method that was calling the log method
member.remarks: The method is walking up the frames in the stack trace until the first method outside is reached. When log calls to are wrapped in an application, this may still not be the method where logging was called initially (e.g. when an exception occurred and has been logged). In that case set accordingly to get outside the wrapper method(s).
member.param: How many frames to skip when detecting the calling method. This is useful when log calls to are wrapped in an application. Default is 0.
member.returns: Class and method that was calling the log method

member.name: F:Atom.SDK.Net.InternetHelper.ConnectivityStates.None
member.summary: The underlying network interfaces have no connectivity to any network.

member.summary: There is connectivity to the Internet using the IPv4 protocol.

member.name: F:Atom.SDK.Net.InternetHelper.ConnectivityStates.IPv4LocalNetwork
member.summary: There is connectivity to a routed network using the IPv4 protocol.

member.name: F:Atom.SDK.Net.InternetHelper.ConnectivityStates.IPv4NoTraffic
member.summary: There is connectivity to a network, but the service cannot detect any IPv4 network traffic.

member.summary: There is connectivity to the local subnet using the IPv4 protocol.

member.summary: There is connectivity to the Internet using the IPv4 protocol.

member.name: F:Atom.SDK.Net.InternetHelper.ConnectivityStates.IPv6LocalNetwork
member.summary: There is connectivity to a local network using the IPv6 protocol.

member.name: F:Atom.SDK.Net.InternetHelper.ConnectivityStates.IPv6NoTraffic
member.summary: There is connectivity to a network, but the service cannot detect any IPv6 network traffic

member.name: F:Atom.SDK.Net.InternetHelper.ConnectivityStates.IPv6Subnet
